intro: Trachymene oblonga, commonly known as the narrowleaf false daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs during the spring and summer months, producing clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Trachymene oblonga is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued in traditional herbal medicine.
